_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Hawkins, Inc. is a progressive business that supplies chemicals, delivery systems and expertise to improve the environment.  We create alternative solutions for delivery and assist customers in creating new offerings across many markets. Our traditional focus has been on the sale, delivery and safe handling of bulk chemicals. Today, Hawkins, Inc. is becoming more specialized by working with customers with very exacting specifications seeking appropriate and innovative alternatives to meet their needs.



The Hawkins Water Treatment Group (WTG) provides water and waste-water treatment equipment and chemicals to improve the quality of life and operate in concert with the environment.



Hawkins also serves regional customers in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices and metal finishing.  Food manufacturers, processing plants, and pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending and related expertise. 



Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier. We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.



Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins' management has set a goal that "Zero Can Be Done" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this goal is manifested in a number of ways such as:

? A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental department staffed with trained professionals.

? Training programs in chemical safety, accident prevention and emergency response.

? Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent future occurrences.

? Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

? Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping of mater

ials.

? Audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  The Hawkins Water Treatment Group - Apopka Facility is a chemical blending and distribution warehouse that stores and distributes a number of materials used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools and other uses.  The products covered in our Risk Management and Process Safety Management Plan for this facility is chlorine.  This product is not manufactured, packaged or used at this facility.  Chlorine is storage in 150 pound cylinders for distribution only.

Prevention Program:  Accident prevention is achieved through handling procedures that properly protect chemicals during shipping and storage.  This starts with DOT approved cylinders that are robustly designed to contain chemicals through all conditions expected during processing as well as mishandling that could cause a cylinder to fall or shift during transport.  It continues through having employees trained in proper handling procedures, and equipping them with equipment to safely move chemicals during storage and transportation.  Adherence to OSHA workplace rules is just another part of our safety program.  We also follow industry standards, such as those of the Chlorine Institute, to ensure that our equipment and procedures are protective of the health and safety of our employees, the environment, and the surrounding community.



5-Year Accident History:  As a result of our diligence, there has not been an accident involving chlorine at this facility since the purchase of this operation in September 2014.  



Emergency Response:  In the event of a chlorine release, Hawkins Water Treatment Group employees are trained to investigate the situation and if needed:

1. Call the local fire department for hazmat assistance.

2. Evacuate to a safe distance.  



Planned Changes:  While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are
no specific changes planned other than to continue compliance with industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Think Safe! Be Safe!"
